Legacy Document

Important: The information in this document is obsolete and should not be used for new development.

Inside Macintosh:

Files

Inside Macintosh: Files describes the parts of the Macintosh Operating System that allow you to manage files and other objects in the file system. This book shows in detail how your application can handle the commands typically found in the File menu. You'll learn how to
  • create, open, update, save, and close files
  • customize the user interface for opening and saving files
  • search for specific files or directories on a volume
  • obtain information about files or directories on a volume
  • manage shared files
  • keep track of specific files
  • initialize and erase disks
  • perform other advanced file-related operations
Additional aspects of the Macintosh Operating System are discussed in these Inside Macintosh books: Memory, Processes, Operating System Utilities, and Devices.

Availability: Click below to obtain Inside Macintosh: Files in any of the following formats.
PDF
